description:

The customer is one of the largest international clothing-retail companies known for its fast-fashion clothing. The business concept is to offer fashion and quality at the best price in a sustainable way.

Project Team:
When you join our team, you’ll be immersed in a culture where teammates always help each other achieve better results. We believe that together we are greater and can find brilliant solutions by sharing ideas.

Requirements:
• Proven work experience with Data Collection and Analysis, Data Engineering, and modeling
• Experience with Data management best practices
• Ability to use various analytical Tools: PowerPoint, Web analytics, Visual Analytics, Power BI, Looker, Alteryx, Excel
• Advanced knowledge and coding skills in SQL, Python, R, HTML, JavaScript.
• Familiarity with Azure Data Factory
• General understanding of AR/VR, Blockchain, No code/low code, IoT.
• Basic knowledge of SPSS, Machine Learning
• Experience working with Agile methodology
•... Business and industry understanding
• Strong customer focus, commercial mindset, and innate curiosity
• Understanding of using numerical, statistical, and analytical methods to apply to data processing considering user experience and user research and ability to transform it into clear insights
• Ability to visualize, communicate and explain data and its implications to stakeholders
• Ability to establish priorities with clear goals and responsibilities to achieve a high level of performance aligning with the strategic goals of the business

English level:
Intermediate+

Responsibilities:
• With high customer and consumer centricity, empower stakeholders to improve customer value through expert analysis of various types of customer data
• Manage project delivery, planning, and steering to ensure effective product development and management
• Handle project and product risk and issue management
• Advocate data-driven decision-making through for example, experimentation and other quantitative analysis
• Design advanced analytics solutions together with business stakeholders and product/analytics teams to maximize impact; function as the link and catalyst
• Analyze data using the latest web analytics and business intelligence techniques (e.g. Power BI or web analysis dashboards)
• Manage cloud infrastructure

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Are you passionate about data analysis and willing to have a real impact on improving data culture in a global organization? Then join us as a Senior Data Analyst! Data is at the heart of everything we do, and we’re looking for a candidate who can take ownership of technical data assets, and support all other departments in making full use of them.

You will be remotely working with a seasoned and highly motivated, multi-cultural team of Data Engineers, DataOps, Data Scientists and Data Analysts spread across Europe. You will have the challenge of supporting business needs in a fast-changing environment and helping AirHelp reach the next level of data maturity.

You will work with the team on developing relevant data models and generating valuable insights. You will also be in charge of conducting advanced analysis and developing appealing visualizations, dashboards and storytellings for business stakeholders.

What you’ll do:
• Work with business stakeholders to collect, understand... and document business requirements.
• Design and develop robust data models using Snowflake, dbt, etc.
• Develop advanced analysis to obtain relevant insights and build appealing storytelling using HEX, Jupyter Notebooks, etc.
• Design, develop, and maintain data-reporting dashboards using commercial BI tools.
• Mentor and share your technical expertise with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts and other AirHelp technology colleagues.

Ideally, you’ll bring with you:
• 3+ years in a data analyst role working with large datasets, both using Python (Jupyter Notebooks, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, etc) and commercial BI tools.
• Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or any other with a strong quantitative component.
• Proficient expertise in SQL, including the ability to clean, extract and manipulate data.
• Experience with commercial BI tools (Periscope, Looker, Tableau or others).
• Structured, critical, systematic and scientific thinking.
• Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
• Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.

Nice to have:
• Solid understanding of corporate financial processes (Budget, Forecast, Treasury)
• Experience working in agile environments, preferably with Jira.
• Solid understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices
• Hands-on experience with data transformation and data modeling using dbt framework.
• Solid understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices.
• Hands-on experience using Snowflake or similar Cloud Data Warehousing solutions (Redshift, BigQuery, etc).

Make a real impact on travel

At AirHelp, you will make a difference working with the world's largest organization specializing in air passenger rights. We support travelers around the world and help them get the compensation they deserve when their flight doesn't go according to the plan. We're a global, diverse team that helps make air travel better for all. In 10 years, we’ve helped 1.5 million people receive the compensation they were entitled to when their flight was delayed, canceled or diverted. We’re really proud of our 102k 5-star Trustpilot ratings.

Perks and benefits:
• Internal training programs and knowledge-sharing events
• Personalized progression plan
• Language classes
• Lunch subsidy
• Flexible benefits: gym membership, personal education, childcare, public transportation, or leisure travel subsidy
• MacBook Air
• Hybrid workspace (partially remote, partially from one of our offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk or Krakόw)
• Work from anywhere for 2 weeks a year
• Team days
• Events and parties

• Video call with the Recruiter

title: Risk Data Analyst
description:
Counterparty Credit Risk Data Analytics Team analyses trade volume and exposure trends to identify and address data quality issues that impact exposure calculations. This is accomplished by working closely with our partners in Counterparty Risk Analytics, Credit Risk Management and Technology to improve the integrity of the factors, processes and systems that impact data quality. The team is comprised of risk professionals with subject matter expertise of the key attributes that are critical for effective exposure calculations (PSE, NSE) on Derivatives (OTC) and Securities (SFT) products. This includes knowledge of systems, exposure calculations, transaction data and market data.
The proactive identification and improvement of Risk data quality through analysis of key risk inputs and exposure measurements.

Perform risk data quality analysis and address potential risk process and exposure calculation improvements across multiple businesses: Risk Management, IT, Finance, Front Office... etc. specializing in Over-The-Counter Traded Derivatives (OTC) and Securities Finance Transactions (SFT) products.

Key responsibilities:
• Proactive identification of potential issues in credit risk exposure calculations (Pre-settlement, Net Stressed)
• Perform Variance analysis on key risk portfolios and business data focused on Securities products
• Maintain reasonability checks on crucial risk/finance attributes and calculations
• Assist in identification of critical data elements for key risk processes in partnership with consumers

The position provides an exposure to Institutional Credit Management, Senior Credit Risk and Business Management, Risk Analytics, Margining Group and Financial Control as well as Front Office Technology. Elemy is the nationwide provider of childhood mental healthcare and behavioral therapy in the US. Senior Data Analyst, Product
